comment: I thoroughly enjoyed this class. It was difficult, but medical genetics is a difficult subject. Everything was covered well in class for the test and objectives were clear. One of my favorite classes at KSU.

Just no! I can overlook a language barrier, but this is a difficult topic for most ..& her exams did not help at all. Each exam only had like 5Qs, so basically miss one or two and you fail the entire exam. Only thing that saved my grade was the optional cumulative final. Overall I just felt as though she made this course unnecessarily difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Worst professor I have EVER taken a class with. DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING WITH HER.

The worst professor I've *ever* taken. This topic is not easy, but she makes it a million times harder for no reason. I got a C on a brochure for absolutely no reason. Her rubric did not reflect what she expected. Even if there was no language barrier, just bc you have PHD in something doesnt mean you should teach, and she should NOT teach
Definitely a language barrier which affects the way she writes her exams, which makes you interpret the questions wrong sometimes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I went in thinking "no way she can be as bad as the reviews say, people just don't wanna put in effort" but man I am telling you she is as bad as the reviews say. After the first test you will realize it too. Her questions are unfair and confusing to understand. Half of them were too broad to properly answer, even if you know information. Avoid.

I would give her a 0 if i could. If you have to take it for your major, take another professor. If its just an elective credit, take ANY other class. This professor is not accessible outside of class to help students, brushes you off when you asked to set up office appointments. Her tests are confusing and you get no help. Lectures are min. helpful
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Trust me when I tell you this class will drop your GPA. Do not take if possible. The material is on par with ochem or cell bio. However, you cannot muscle through this bad of a teacher. She is hard to get in contact with, tests are poorly written (language barrier), and she puts in MINIMAL effort towards helping students. From Student w/ 3.75 sGPA

I would give anything to have this professor fired. She is not helpful AT ALL with a difficult subject. Tries to trick you on tests purposely then acts like youre stupid for thinking the answer was something else. Confuses you so much more if you ask about something in lecture. Avoid at all costs. Take literally ANY other class thats not with her
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is probably the worst professor at KSU. Her lecture material does not correspond to the book. Huge language barrier on her tests. Huge ego when it comes to teaching and does not want to help students.
AWFUL!!!!!!!! Do not take this professor for ANYTHING!!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Top 3 worst classes Ive ever taken at KSU. 4 tests and a brochure. Tests are very tricky. Shes a very harsh grader. Need more point opportunities (homework, quizzes etc) if the tests are going to be so hard.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Took this because there's no lab and I got an A in genetics. big mistake. Only grades are exams and a brochure. Her exam Qs almost all have options like A&B/all but C. Genetics is already confusing & so are her exam Q answer choices. Although her accent isnt hard to understand, shes quiet, monotone, and confuses you more after asking a question.

I actually enjoyed lectures, thought she taught the difficult subject very well. I found no language barrier when listening to her. However, I believe that there is a barrier when she writes tests. Every question was a trick question. Also, dont ask questions, she either doesnt explain well, repeats herself, or you end up sorry you asked.

Language barrier sometimes creates confusion in questions/answers b/w students and Dr. Hauge, but she is very knowledgeable. Read your book/any papers she posts on D2L and complete the study guides in detail. She is a tough grader, but what can you expect from an upper level course/elective taught by a PhD? Good luck!

Spent the entire lab class lecturing about what we already knew from the lab manual. Unable to answer simple questions. Easily confused and definite language barrier. I had to teach her how to use a piece of equipment. Worst experience of college. Had almost 100 in lecture and would leave her lab confused. Rude and unapproachable. AVOID IF YOU CAN
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Worst professor I have EVER had. She is subjective in her grading, clearly shows when she doesn't  like you vs when she likes a student. She will tear you down for little things. She complained about having to teach us. If we knew the course material why would we be here? I've seen 4 students actually cry b/c her. DO NOT TAKE XUEYA HAUGE.

Tests did not accurately reflect the course material, and the book used was pretty lackluster. On more than one occasion she harassed and made several students cry/almost cry. Lab was poorly put together and centered on her own research - for which you needed to get your blood drawn.  I would never take her again or recommend her to anyone.

Every day in this class was painful. She turned lab into a confusing lecture, often contradicting herself.  She assigned only 2 lab reports, and graded too harshly. Additionally the two lab reports seemed to be very ill-conceived it was as if she picked two labs at random to assign without considering whether or not they should be lab reports.

Very interesting subject material. Took her for Molecular Genetics and was not disappointed with the level of knowledge presented. Extremely knowledgeable of higher genetics with years of direct work experience. Be sure to come to class prepared and brushed up on your chromosome biology; READ THE BOOK, it was extremely helpful. Lab was challenging.

I think she is a nice person and really tries to understand your question. Sometimes, she doesn't understand and answers something completely different. You're better off asking a classmate. READ THE BOOK. She is hard, but she teaches mostly 4000 level classes. That is expected. She is nice.

Overall she's a pretty nice lady. Her accent is very heavy and she's difficult to understand.  It gets easier as the semester goes on. She seems confused most of the time during lecture and she doesn't always grade tests correctly. Arguments after getting tests back were common. She would frequently have to go back and add points to grades.

Very large language barrier. Doesn't always understand what you are saying when you ask her a question. Still no idea where some of her test questions came from. Office hours are not helpful. I was seeking outside help for the class and still did not do well. Sometimes teaches wrong material. Learned nothing. Wish I would have taken someone else.

Really wants to help you, shes tries, most students hate her, but guess what its a 3000 level bio, so you should be reading and teaching yourself almost at this point. 95% of questions right from the book reading is a must. Not hard questions. A few times she had a wrong answer and would not change it cost me an A on one test. Still made an A.

If you're going to college, and have broken free of the illusion that most of the below raters suffer as they rant about how they need to do actual work to pass the class, then I encourage you to take Dr. Hauge's courses. They can be challenging and intensive, but you will learn more of the subject matter than you would in most other classes.
Dr. Hauge is a challenging professor but I learned a ton! She knows what she is talking about and doesnt spoon feed the information, you will have to study to do well but hey this is college!

Worst does not begin the describe her, She is rude and the test don;t come form the book or class notes. She made an error on grading my paper and when I showed it to her she said well it is already recorded and would not change it. DO NOT TAKE HER.

I ignored all the bad reviews about Dr. Hauge, thinking they were from bad students, but most of the things on here are true! She's the worst teacher I've ever had. She didn't use the book, her lectures were unclear and unorganized, and tests are rediculous! She tests over details that she hasn't even covered in class. I'm glad she curved for us!

I do not recomend taking her, unless you're looking for an F or D. she has a very thick accent,so you have to read the chapter b4 coming to class in order to understand what she might be talking about. Her test is Very HArd!!! she enjoyed taking points off. and if you ask why? she will confuse you with her answer, so you'll prefer to go with what s

She doesnt follow the syllabus and expects us to read the chapter before coming to class. She isnt helpful when asked questions and doesnt make it easy for students to approach her. If you can avoid taking her.

DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH HER. She contradicts the book and is very rude.  She never answers your questions.  She takes off points on lab assignments and won't explain to you why.  Horrible teacher that I would NEVER recommend to anyone.

took her foor medical genetics cnt understand her gives out notes but uhav to attend she wont giv u if u missed the class gives study guides but her tests are sumthin else even if u study the study guide she goes in deep roots then she has short essay question worth lot of points and cuts off lot points too essays are hard even ifuthink uknow stuff
She's pretty much just a bad teacher all around... refuses to help students, grades subjectively, can't understand what she says, booooooooooring

The most non-sympathetic woman who has no family values. I had a family emergency and had to miss several days. She originally agreed that I would be excused but once I came back she tried to make me do all the work I missed, called me irresponsible, and said she didn't understand why it was important for me to be with my family and not at school.
Read the book, tests are usually straight from the book. I made a B in the class, and never went to class, just read the book. Her lectures are confusing so there is no point in attending her class.

Worst teacher I have ever had in my life.  I don't pay to go to school to teach myself the material.  Huge language barrier.  Classes are very boring, if you have to take her...stay home and read the book instead of going to class.  Use the cdrom that comes with the book.
Very difficult to understand subject matter. Does not clearly explain. Study text for test.
this woman is a devil in human form. She's the worst teacher u could ever imagine. Think twice before u take her class. She's not helpful, and she makes life real hard for u.
No Comments
The Worst Teacher Ever. EEEVVVVERRR. Avoid the pain and take someone else.
She is the worst teacher I have ever had!  Do not take her.
